name: sliced in sauce
title: Vital Balance Junior · sliced in sauce · Salmon & carrots
description: Vital Balance sliced in sauce Salmon & carrots Junior

mainInformation.origin: You can find information about the origin on the packaging in the store.

petFoodBasicInformation.composition: Composition: Meat and animal derivatives, Vegetable protein extracts, Fish and fish derivatives (salmon 4%), Oils and fats, Derivatives of vegetable origin, minerals, Vegetables (0.6% dehydrated carrot, equivalent to 5.4% carrot), Various sugars.
petFoodBasicInformation.additives: Additives: Nutritional additives: IU/kg: Vit A: 1230; Vit D3: 171; Vit E: 300; mg/kg: Iron(II) sulphate monohydrate: (Fe: 14.9); Calcium iodate anhydrous: (I: 0.43); Copper(II) sulphate pentahydrate: (Cu:1.1); Manganous sulphate monohydrate: (Mn:2.0); Zinc sulphate monohydrate: (Zn:21.4); taurine: 560. Flavourings.

usageInformation.additionalInformation: With the delicious and nutritious PURINA VITAL BALANCE meals, developed by vets & nutritionists, you can be sure that your cat receives all the nutrients it needs every day for a visible sense of well-being.

petFoodStorageInformation.instructions: Feeding guide: For kittens from 6 to 12 weeks, feed 2 to 3 pouches per day; from 12 to 26 weeks, feed 3 to 4 pouches per day and from 26 to 52 weeks, feed 4 pouches per day in at least 2 separate meals or at will. Each kitten is different, depending on activity level and body condition, food amounts and/or time allowed to eat may need to be adjusted. For pregnant or nursing cats: feed as much as your cat will eat with 5-10 pouches. Serve at room temperature. Clean, fresh drinking water should always be available

otherInformation.legalDesignation: Complete pet food for kittens between 1 and 12 months
otherInformation.distributorStreetAndNumber: (CH) Nestlé Suisse S.A., Nestlé Purina PetCare, CP 352, CH-1800 Vevey

remarks.value: Keep pet food in a cool and dry place.

mainSpecificities.code: Food needs per day in bowls

mainSpecificities.value: Die empfohlenen täglichen Mengen sollten sich je nach Wetter,  dem Aktivitätslevel der Katze und ihrem physischen Allgemeinzustand richten. Sauberes,  frisches Trinkwasser sollte jederzeit zur Verfügung stehen.
